headline: CNBC Daily Open: Netflix bows out from Warner Bros. Discovery bidding war
summary: Netflix on Thursday stateside said it declined to raise a counteroffer for Warner Bros. Discovery's studio and streaming assets.

headline: Warner Bros. Discovery Weighs Paramount Bid Against Netflix Deal Narrative
summary: Warner Bros. Discovery (NasdaqGS:WBD) is reviewing an improved takeover bid from Paramount that its board says could qualify as a Company Superior Proposal versus its existing Netflix agreement. The board is consulting advisors and has given Netflix a set window to match Paramount's enhanced offer, creating a live bidding contest between two major media groups. This review process marks a key point for Warner Bros. Discovery's future ownership structure and could influence how its content...

headline: US cable MNVOs: sticking the free-to-paid landing is mission critical
summary: In Q4 2025, the three largest cable MVNOs—Spectrum Mobile, Xfinity Mobile, and Optimum Mobile—added 830,000 net mobile lines. Retaining and converting those to revenue has become operation critical

headline: Netflix ditches deal for Warner Bros. Discovery after Paramount’s offer is deemed superior
summary: Netflix is ditching a deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery's studio and streaming assets after the WBD board deemed a revised bid by Paramount to be superior.

headline: New Xfinity Store Opens in Fort Lauderdale
summary: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla., February 26, 2026--Comcast is celebrating the grand opening of its newest Xfinity Store in South Florida, marking its 10th retail location in Broward County. Located at 5554 North Federal Highway, Suite 4A, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33308, the store features an interactive, modern design that gives residents the opportunity to explore the full suite of Xfinity products and services.

headline: How Netflix, Paramount Sparked A $108 Billion Media War For Warner Bros. Discovery
summary: The sale of HBO-owner Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ: WBD) has become the entertainment and streaming industry's Game of Thrones, with Netflix Inc (NASDAQ: NFLX) and Paramount Skydance (NASDAQ: PSKY) battling for control. Here's a timeline of events so far.
